criterion: Reward for comprehensive documentation that captures every clinically relevant fact explicitly or implicitly stated in the transcript (patient took extra furosemide dose, experienced dizziness, feels somewhat better today, no weight change or swelling, clinician acknowledges kidney function concern and proposes dosing/timing adjustment with daughter's help, monitor weight/swelling).

Penalize for omitting or inaccurately stating any of the above encounter facts (e.g., failure to mention the extra dose, dizziness, lack of swelling, or the proposed collaboration with the daughter) or altering their sequence or speaker attribution.

Reward for accurately documenting the medication–symptom linkage: explicit mention that the patient may have taken an extra dose of furosemide and that this could have caused the dizziness, exactly as discussed.

Penalize for copying or inserting chart information that was neither referenced nor relevant in the conversation (e.g., full medication list, unrelated conditions, historical data) or for misrepresenting chart data (wrong age, wrong condition names).
Penalize for fabrications or additions not grounded in the transcript or chart (e.g., new diagnoses, lab orders, vitals, counseling details, or safety warnings that were never mentioned).
